_comment: Created by NCODowd on 27/04/2016 10:33:42 using v2.7
title: Proportion of treatment users waiting three weeks or less for first intervention
analysis_commentary: From 2009/10 to 2014/15, adult waiting times to treatment improved. Since 2013/14, over 95% of first interventions started within three weeks of referral, with an average waiting time of 3.3 days to access services. The greatest improvements in waiting times were in alcohol treatment, increasing from 78.2% of people waiting less than three weeks for treatment in 2009/10 to 95.4% in 2013/14.
data_source: Public Health England, National Drug Treatment Monitoring System
